website_summaries.verdict: Attractive details and a sturdy construction offer the best of both worlds. Ideal for parents who want a good looking gate without sacrificing safety.
pros: Black steel frame, complemented with cherry wood, is sturdy and aesthetically pleasing
Adjustable to fit a variety of staircase widths
Comes with tools for both pressure and hardware installation
Extra height with a child-safe lock to prevent unauthorized excursions
cons: Walk through opening is somewhat narrow
Securely shutting the gate can be noisy

website_summaries.verdict: An attractive gate for a decent price. Aesthetic wins over many buyers.
cons: Walk-through portion is a bit narrow

customer_reviews.title: Love this gate
customer_reviews.text: Love this gate! I have a 90 lb boxer lab mix that likes to jump all over the door as soon as I pull into the driveway. To work on our training I got this gate so he can't jump on the door or me as soon as I walk in. At first I was hesitant because he's a very large dog and very strong but this gate is stronger and tall enough to keep him out. Very impressed, would definitely recommend this to anyone with a big dog or disturbingly strong, hulk-like toddler. Guaranteed they won't get past this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for tenacious pets.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a taller gate as one of my dogs discovered the springs in his hind legs could launch him over. This one seemed to be just the vertical addition needed. Good height but not enough as apparently this dog should be a professional jumper. The big problem is because of the three price construction. My smallest dog has identified the weak points where the pieces join together, so now I get to watch ALL my dogs snoozing on the couch because they've successfully taken down the hallway gate. Will try to fix this with zip ties but just be aware that this gate doesn't provide the security of Fort Knox.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: Welding completely failed in two locations!  SAFETY HAZARD.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfectly fine - until the welding failed in two locations. Two of the metal posts detached, leaving the gate totally useless as the kids can fit through. This gate was used for less than 3 weeks when the welding failures occurred - it was not heavily abused or anything. I've emailed the manufacturer because this is a huge safety hazard. Imagine if the gate had been installed at the top of a staircase! Do not purchase this if you need something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Fink

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a great gate but it isn't the gate pictured
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a great gate but it isn't the gate pictured. Photo pictured with item shows a good 12" extension on the left. That's not what you get. Second picture shows actual item sent with very small 4" extension piece. Since I already own two of the gates pictured I presumed that's what I'd receive, no need to read description since we live in a world where pictures have replaced words. Road signs, bathrooms, building signs, emoji's..... The picture really should display actual item being sold.
customer_reviews.author: Cali-kaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I first gave it 4star but now I change it to one. The locking mechanism does not workproperly after only two months . I have to pull and push the button for several times that it locks finally. I will not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: It's SO nice. It looks exactly as I expected, it's easy to use. Our 5 year old (not the one we're trying to gate) can easily open and shut it which is nice. It's easily adjustable with the extra pieces and tension rods. Have moved it a couple times and it has never left marks on the wall. The door swings both ways so it's easy coming up and going down the stairs where we have it. Will definitely be purchasing another in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Jo CatherineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not for small pups.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Looks beautiful. Just for use with small dogs. My pup squeezed through and his butt got him stuck. I have a 3 lb Pomeranian and toy poodle mix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gate!
customer_reviews.text: These gates are perfect. I bought 2 for my house to block off entry way of my house and my bedroom. I have 3 dogs and needed a tall gate. I love these. They look nice too. I did have some trouble installing them so my boyfriend had to install it for me. I'm not good at installing things anyway.
customer_reviews.author: maranda giebler

customer_reviews.title: Gate is perfect!! We needed to set it up in ...
customer_reviews.text: Gate is perfect!! We needed to set it up in our hallway to keep dogs out. It's very sturdy. NOTE: It comes with an orange ATTENTION card to let you know that the gate is NOT defective as it looks bent. This is correct!! It's high and no bending down to have to open and close. Best part, my chihuhua pups cannot fit through the gaps! (they are not tea cup Chi's) Very pleased! It looks classier then those old wooden gates too!
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Courville

customer_reviews.title: Terrific gates
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these gates to keep my dogs out of rooms and off of furniture. I have received several compliments on the appearance of these gates. I did purchase the Black Baby Gates Wall Pads (4 Pack Guard) by vmax to use with these although they are not necessary. However, I did not want to attach the included bases to my walls (with screws) and the wall pads solve that issue without slipping. I used 3M Double Sided Black Foam Tape Mounting Pad Adhesive (Round) to affix the included bases into the rubber wall pads and it is working like a charm. The gates don't detract from the homes appearance like some other cheaper gates do.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Functional and good looking
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to install and is much nicer looking than the old white gate I was using. This is taller too to prevent my athletic whippets from trying to get over it. Why 4 stars? I hate to say it but there is this huge ugly warning sticker on it and it's one of those that won't come off easily. You can see it in my photo and it really detracts from the appearance and wraps around the edge. I'm sure it will be a pain to get it off along with the residue.
customer_reviews.author: Sixfourtwofifty

customer_reviews.title: I like the style but it was defective and It won't ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the style but it was defective and It won't lock. How the hell we can close it if it won't latch. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: ellashiella

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a doorway between our living room and kitchen. It is a smaller doorway so we only needed 1 of the extensions. The downside is, the screws are too long to fit properly into the designated slots. Then, they do not have anything to keep them from wobbling around, creating a loose gate. If we try to tighten it up, the gate will not open and close. We had cut the tightening screws to fit properly. We also had no choice but to use the wall mount pieces as we could not tighten it to the wall enough and still open the gate. Overall, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Leia W.

customer_reviews.title: New gate not as good as the old one.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I have an older model that works great. I bought this newer model and it comes with two small extensions. The old one has a short and a long extension. But the new one has longer screws to hold the gate in place which don’t work as well as the old one. Also, the company is dose not have the extension in stock. So, now I have a wobbly baby gate. But I’m sure the company saved money by not including the bigger extension. ***Update. The company does not sell replacement latches. So if the 50 cent plastic piece in the locking mechanism breaks you are SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Trep

customer_reviews.title: Latch spring is junk making gate useless
customer_reviews.text: The didn't even last a year before the spring gave out in the latch on one side. It isn't in a high traffic area so I'm a little dismayed that it gave out. It still works but you have to squeeze harder on the other side to get the latch to release and that's tough on my arthritic hands. Not impressed. Update: Now neither side works. Wrote company requesting latch replacement parts. No response. What good it a "gate" if you can't open it? Grrrr.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not the same gate as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Not the same gate as advertised. I ordered this gate (the one in the pic) a few months back, and recently needed to replace another gate in the house. The new gate we received had a different lever to open and has an adjustable stopper so it can open both ways, making it flimsier at the bottom. Wish they would have shown these features in a “newer model” sign or something. Also, the wood is a lot darker on this new model.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Walker

customer_reviews.title: Next.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this gate zero stars I would. Looks wise it is “prettier” than other models BUT the wood cane scratched on ours. Also the gate only opens in one direction so on our staircase the warning labels face out. Functionally the gate sucks. The opening is incredibly narrow. I’m very thin but I still have to turn sideways to slide through. Not very guest friendly. The mounts constantly slip and cause tension to be lost and the gate to pop open. I HATE this gate. It’s a huge pain. The rubber stoppers that hold tension are now coming apart too. Definitely not worth the money. Awful awful awful.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Attractive
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my doorway to master bedroom area to prevent the dog from having access. I really did not need one this tall but it would work great for keeping a taller toddler corralled in a room. It was available and less expensive so now we have 4 different child/pet gates to meet our needs. Pro: Black metal with wood insets that look nice in our home Less expensive than some Con: The gate only swings in one direction which takes some getting accustomed to. Clumsy folks like me will find the opening mechanism awkward. Taller than necessary Narrow tall gate makes it difficult to carry anything through it..
customer_reviews.author: Gmafaye

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic breaks
customer_reviews.text: The gate is put together with a tiny plastic piece that broke after just one month. Now the gate falls off the frame and I had to tie it on to hold it in place. The way it’s made there is no way to fix this and will probably happen to the other gates as well. Update-after 4 months the second gate broke same spot. That’s 2 out of 3 that have broken.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well to kids and big dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to keep our 2 fifty pound dogs closed in a room when we aren't home or have guests that they could jump on and injure. Works great and hold up to them join on it and hitting it. It's also tall enough that out dog who can jump relatively high cannot get over it, nor has she even attempted it. We also have kids who play around with it and are constantly opening and closing it and it has stood up to them also. The bars are not wide enough fot a cat to get through, but more agile cats can jump over it.
customer_reviews.author: MrsSerfes

customer_reviews.title: it is as described
customer_reviews.text: 1st: I would not want to put a lot of weight against this at the top of stairs. 2nd: it is as advertised and works well as pet gate 3rd: if you don't want to constantly readjust it, do the permanent install 4th: think twice about the height - can get in way of carrying something through gate; our old one was lower and never an issue, now carrying laundry basket or child across can be an issue 5th: narrow width of gate itself for big people; but it is as described We like it but had to think about the above after using it a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Frezno

customer_reviews.title: Needs better engineering
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, both simultaneously broke and it’s something within the locking system so it’s unable to be fixed. We have not been rough with them and the babies certainly haven’t. Now they can be popped open with a littl push no matter how tight I make them to compensate. These look great and added a nice vibe to my room so for the first couple months we loved them. If we were given replacements I would change this review.
customer_reviews.author: JMaynP

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We installed the gate in the doorway between our kitchen and dining room to confine our pup. After three months of heavy use (frequent opening/closing and staying secure against the weight of a 50 pound dog), the gate has performed wonderfully. The mounting system and latching mechanism have never failed. The only negatives I'd offer is that there's a steel bar across the bottom that's a trip hazard and the gate does reduce the access through the doorway fairly significantly. We've adjusted just fine and mainly, have been just delighted that it looks and functions so well.
customer_reviews.author: Jozie

customer_reviews.title: Great visual appeal, but it is a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these gates. Although they’re the same one has the double sided buttons and the other has the single top button. I much prefer the single top button. It’s easier to open when your hands are full. We do love the looks of these gates and the extra height as it prevents our dogs from jumping the gates. However, they feel flimsy especially the single top button one. I’m afraid as our infant gets older she could make it come crashing down the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ke44

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but a good option.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little more work to install with baseboards. The height is nice, but it falls right at the door knob. So, you have to find just the right place to set up. Also, the opening is wayyy too tight for an average person to go through. None of these were dealbreakers bc I wanted something tall that my dogs wouldn't be tempted to jump and I wanted something stylish that would blend in with the fixtures in my home. This was the best option.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gate for our Delilah
customer_reviews.text: We got this gate to keep our 45 lb. Pit Bull Terrier secure during the day while we were at work. It works like a charm if you install it as instructed. Don't make the mistake of thinking that the tension in the gate is enough to keep a medium to large size dog secure. It didn't work for us. One good push and she was free. Take the time and screw the caps into place. You won't regret. This is a very nice looking gate, but the entrance is fairly narrow, so consider that if you are a larger person. I'm 5" 1 @ 148 lbs. and I have to be careful going through it with my hands full.
customer_reviews.author: L. Helfert

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. No screw mounts
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that came with the screw in mounts not the pressure mounts and this claimed that it did that. It did not come with anything but the pressure mounts. So it is absolutely useless to me. What a waste of money. Though it's beautiful. Even after contacting the company they lied to me and told me to buy something completely ugly that would not work for my situation. I am angry and I will never purchase another item from this company again
customer_reviews.author: cantmakesushi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gate, very narrow opening
customer_reviews.text: If you need a decent gate, that looks good, and is functional, this is a great gate. The only thing I don't like is that for a bigger guy, the narrow gate is a bit frustrating - but you do get used to it. My other gate almost fully swings the entire width of the door, and I like that better, but it is very short and my 90 German shepherd thinks nothing of jumping the gate to drink potty water. This prevents that from happening. Just wish that darn opening was a bit wider. No worries on quality, sturdy (no dog can chew through this), and looks good too!
customer_reviews.author: notsoNEWKINDLEUSER

customer_reviews.title: How did the company let this get shipped????
customer_reviews.text: So, I definitely was a little sceptical about the product bc of some of the bad reviews but I try to stay open-minded for you never know what you yourself will get. The box came crazy damaged but I'm not too worried about a box. BUT the product itself was defective too! The door latch doesn't even reach its lock.... Smh. That's truly bad manufacturing on the company's part. For the life of me, I can't understand how the company let this particular gate, pass the assembly line or inspection. I called, but no answer. I doubt I will ever trust this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Totally solved our problem
customer_reviews.text: We were using a traditional baby gate to keep our pets downstairs. Some members of our family had a very hard time using the gate. I saw this one at my sister's home and she raved about it. I ordered it as soon as we returned from our trip. It arrived quickly, and though it took me a bit of time to figure it out, it installed perfectly. It looks far better than the traditional wooden & plastic grid baby gate and the members of our family that had trouble managing the old gate have now mastered this one. Happy all around!
customer_reviews.author: khardy3352

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Prime Day deal. I got this to gate off a stairway leading to the upstairs loft so my dogs won't go up there. Originally, we had one of the cheaper wooden tension doors that we either would have to cautiously step over or remove and put back in place. I decided on have a gate that could be passed through effortlessly and remain in place. This works splendidly and was super easy to assemble and put in place. I would recommend buying the guards/wall cups to prevent damage to your wall or baseboards that occurs over time. Otherwise, fantastic gate that allows you to pass through and secure with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Not the same.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate about a year ago and loved it. The quality was great as well as durability. So I hit the Reorder option when I needed another one. Something changed. The quality has decreased. It’s a little flimsy now. There are more pieces to assemble which causes more flexibility. I’m disappointed. It also swings both ways. The first one had a Stop built in. Don’t like that feature either. I needed this for an upcoming visit by my Mom, so I can’t return it Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Li Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is great! It works well for our upstairs! My husband put a piece of wood on both sides because our opening was a little bigger than the max here. He drilled into the wall instead of using pressure mount too since it was at the top of the stairs. You definitely want a higher gate like this. The only negative I would say is the opening to walk through is narrow. It's narrower than our other one, which is not as Comfortable to walk through with a child. It will work though.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Tricky install, good product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this specifically because it was tension mounted-no screwing hardware into door frames and walls. Technically, maybe, but the tension option easily slid with pressure. Couldn't risk the baby pushing these over and tumbling to the ground with them. Good news is the install cups are included, bad news is they have to be installed multiple times because there's no template for placement. You install the gate fully, mark the walls, uninstall fully, mount parts, then reinstall for good. The quality is good, though it buckles slightly against pressure if using the extender pieces. Overall pretty happy, just took longer getting them installed than I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS WIDE AS ADVERTISED!!!!! Would have been a 5 star for me.
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved this gate had it not be misrepresented!! It's beautiful but totally misrepresented!! I have in quotes below their description which leads you to believe that you can expand to 42" plus 8" with the 2 extensions which would equal 50"!! Not so! "Standing an impressive 37” tall the gate is a perfect height to keep your little climber safe and is easily expandable to fit larger openings. If you have an odd sized hallway or door opening, the gate is versatile fitting doorways between 30”-42”. A 4” extensions kit (above and beyond what is included) can be added to accommodate wider spaces. Additional extensions are sold separately. The gate can accommodate a maximum of 3 extensions."
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: The gate was easy to put up. It seems durable. But we did have the latch stick in open position once and I had to take tweezers to pull it out. But so far it hasn't been stuck since. We purchased it for our 2 cats that do not get along. If you purchase for pets, it's not great for pets on the thinner side. We have since found our 7 lb elderly cat can squeeze between the bars. To keep that from happening again, we have a blanket over the gate (covers the whole gate) and so far that has deterred her from doing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kel K.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this gate I loved it so much I bought another. I went into my orders and clicked on the buy another. I got the gate within a reasonable amount of time, however the second gate was not the same as the first! The handles are different, does not swing open both ways and on top of that it had large scrapes in the brown wood part. The extension did not have the wood like the first one. On the bottom right the hole for the screw was very large and does not fit the screw so it's just flopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe product
customer_reviews.text: Product appears to install well, but, our 2 year old grandson soon found the defect in this product. The bottom of the gate does not secure. On his 2nd try, he was able to tweak the gate open. If it had been at the top of a stair, we could have a bad accident. I bought the baby gate based on other reviews. Maybe our grandson is just quicker than others; but, I still say this could have been a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. GODFREY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gate for Babies and Nana's
customer_reviews.text: Love these gates! Easy to install, durable, beautiful addition to my home. They are elegant but totally functional! I have gotten so many compliments from visitors who just love the look of them. I have arthritis and the easy open latches on this gate make me so happy. I don't have to worry about pain or lack of strength when operating these gates. I have two, one for the kitchen and one for the hallway. The price couldn't get much better for the products durability and aesthetic appeal! I trust that these will keep my granddaughter safe while she is visiting with her nana! You can't go wrong with Regalo.
customer_reviews.author: Ddixon

customer_reviews.title: Good looking gate
customer_reviews.text: This gate is great for our needs. We are older people with a young puppy. Our other gates we had to step over. This you just open the door. Easy to set up, Sturdy. With the black and wood feature it looks good in our home. We did need to put some mess material on the lower part of the gate because our pup can squeeze through the bars. He is just 2.6 lbs. In most cases this would not be a problem. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: I love these gates for my home
customer_reviews.text: I love these gates for my home. They are strong and look good. I did have to replace one because the opening mechanism stopped working. I have a golden retriever and she definitely leaps on them a fair amount and so I felt like it was ok because I had it for about 2 years. Highly recommend. I love being able to walk through. Gates that you have to take down and put up to get through aggravate me. Don't get aggravated by the set up - the latch will connect once it's aligned properly. You'll get the hang of it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: E. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate, love the height
customer_reviews.text: Nice gate, love the height. It is easy to assemble and fits in many sizes of doorways with the attachments. The latch is easy to use to open the "door" of the gate. Speaking of the door - it's not a very wide opening. I have elderly parents that are not big people but they have a hard time going through this gate to get through. They avoid it at all costs. It does what it is supposed to do and looks nice in our room. I took off one star only because of the opening size. I would purchase it again and have recommended it to my fellow pet parents!
customer_reviews.author: pam

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE WARRANTY if you plan on using more that 1 year!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these 21 months ago. The interior plastic latch broke and they offer no replacement. They use the excuse that child safety laws keep them from offering repair parts. BS! When I was informed by their customer service that our only option was to buy a new one, I told her they lost a customer. Shocked they make products that sell at a premium but aren't built to last. I'm thinking most baby gates are needed for at least a couple of years. If you use for pets it's needed much longer. I'd advise to purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: nola

customer_reviews.title: Best baby gate ever!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, where has this thing been all my life??? I wish I would have had this for my first two, but this thing is amazing and keeps my daughter safe. For years I tripped over the smaller gates that Walmart sells, I didn't even know this type of gate existed! I'm 5'3" so me swinging my leg over without dying was no small feat. The quality of this gate is great and it's very sturdy. I can carry a basket of laundry through it with ease and my older boys don't have any trouble getting it open. Spend a little extra on this one, it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: LoveMySoldier

customer_reviews.title: This works grate for dogs and standard doorways
customer_reviews.text: I hate the crappy plastic clasp, I can't wait for it to break so I can fashion something better. I use this to keep my dogs out of the kitchen. The black lab is an insufferable counter surfer and the conniving jack russell eggs him on. So this gate works more than fine for me, but I absolutely would not use this to keep small children from a stairway. I wouldn't trust the plastic clasp with children at all, I've seen way better ones. The extensions don't work very well, if you're counting on extending this gate to its full advertised length, then expect to do some trouble shooting....a trip to the hardware store also.
customer_reviews.author: Lacybug

customer_reviews.title: Good but doesn't seem like it'll last
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect height to keep my dog out of my kitchen. I don't think she's realized she can easily jump over which is great for me. It doesn't close by itself, you have to manually close the door until it clicks. It doesn't look too sturdy either. I will update my review in about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw! Please be aware!!
customer_reviews.text: There is a design flaw with this product. Please be careful. The top can reach to the door, however the bottom of the gate is a little short, so I had to use the extenders to fit. My puppy dog's head gets through the bottom and she gets her head stuck in between the rails!!! The hole's are not small enough for this not to happen! I love the gate, but I wanted everyone to be aware of this flaw. I put boxes on the other side of the gate so my dog doesn't hurt herself when she gets her head stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I'm replacing my Regalo gate I purchased 5 years ago. A plastic piece inside the lock broke and we could no longer open it. This is the exact replacement for the gate, but the quality has gone downhill. This gate is not made as well as my old one. Feels flimsy. Since it is basically to keep the cat out of our bedroom, it should do the job. Let's see if this one lasts as long as it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Townyboy

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for smaller pets, even full grown cats can get through.
customer_reviews.text: This gate is extremely attractive and I was very happy when I opened it. If you are using it as an actually baby gate you should love it. However we bought it for our cats and rabbits. I knew there was a possibility that it might not work for the rabbits yet since they are not full grown. But I was hoping it would work when they are full grown, 8-10 pounds. Now I doubt it, even our 13 pound cats can get between the slats. So if you’re thinking of this for small pets, don’t count on it.
customer_reviews.author: EmyW

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gate
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second one we ordered because we liked the first so well. Excellent for keeping the dog out of the music room but easy access for the humans. I did drop one star as this gate is just a little different from the first - we preferred the earlier model with the release button on each side rather than this one with just one release button on top. Still highly recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. West-fisher

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted a year with heavy traffic, good gate
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this gate for over a year with heavy traffic. It's held up to a chunky cat climbing over it and a 2 yr old wrestling it, as well as a couple older children slamming it shut repeatedly. It is just now starting to wear down from use. The button on one side seems to be stuck, but you can still open it with the button on the other side. Definitely got our money's worth out of it, good gate.
customer_reviews.author: Tananda M. Kalitan

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice in person - Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is awesome! I got this to separate a portion of my kitchen pantry off so my elderly dogs could have their own bedroom on the tile floor. This gate looks high end, even though it does have a plastic locking mechanism. However, after 6 months or so, it’s done a perfect job! I am so glad it looks as nice as it does. It doesn’t look like a traditional cheapo ugly plastic child gate that people always get - it almost looks like it was original, until you look closer and realize it’s a temporary gate. I would definitely recommend for your kids or pet safety!
customer_reviews.author: I'm Erika -- Trust Me.

customer_reviews.title: Not totally happy with this gate.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the height of it but my dog is only 10 pounds and she can get it open. The latch isn’t that strong and she would just push her way through. I reversed it so the door would have to come in word and she can still open it. I keep tightening it but he continues to loosen and she get through. I am not really happy about this because I can’t leave her in the area I wanted blocked off without watching her constantly. I wanted to be able to go take a shower or work in other parts of the house and know that she was safely in the area I wanted her in.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Pontier

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solver
customer_reviews.text: I have very active and TALL 2 year old who wants to explore the whole house. Unfortunately the smaller gates on Amazon are not sturdy and not tall enough for my son. This gate is sturdy and easy to assemble. I'm very impressed with the fact I don't have to say NO 1,000 a day anymore
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh919

customer_reviews.title: Narrow walk-through makes this gate not very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This gate is pretty with the wood accents and the "wrought iron" appearance, but the walk-through is quite narrow. We have to walk sideways to get through. No, we are not obese people, we average sized humans and this gate is uncomfortable. Forget about carrying laundry or groceries through the gate, either. Nope, not going to happen. The added height was one of the features that attracted us to this gate, as we have a standard poodle and he is a tall boy. The gate keeps him in his room just fine, but as for the humans, this gate is a no-go.
customer_reviews.author: Yuvanka Clark

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and easy to assemble but need extensions
customer_reviews.text: Love this gate but, I need extensions, one would do. Since you have to have so much tension to get the latch to catch I am at the very ends of the tension rods. I would love to get an extension and didn't think anything about it until I found the reviews where we could not get them. This is really crazy. I am not sure how to rate this product, I give it a 5 for how great it looks but I would give it just a 2 if I was thinking about not being able to get extensions.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the color
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this gate to fit a 40" wide opening. The gate with both extensions, a 4" and 6" extension, will not fit; it's too big. The gate with one extension will not fit; too much of the screws are exposed on each side. I need two 4" extensions. I cannot locate another extension to purchase; here or on the Regalo website. I am unable to get through to their customer service. Every time I call I get a recorded message that they are not available. Yes, I am calling during normal business hours. I will be returning this gate. Disappointing, I really liked the color.
customer_reviews.author: Nnme

customer_reviews.title: Defective Screws
customer_reviews.text: The gate is a very nice gate. It's attractive and functions well. But...the bottom rail (main rail) is held together by 2 screws, and the screws are very cheap and the heads break off. After the heads break off the gate is useless unless you know someone who can weld the rail together. Luckily my son is a welder, so he fixed it with no problem. Once fixed it works great, and if it wasn't for the defective screws (which would be a huge problem for the average person) I would have given this gate 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SPR5150

customer_reviews.title: Great gate, this is the second one I have purchased but quality issues on this one...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a five star rating but for the fact the build quality of the one I received was poor, frame was bent and wood was damaged (see photos) I contacted support and was unable to just get the part I needed replaced (the gate itself) and they directed me back to Amazon to complete a full return. I need to gate so don't want to return it due to the hassle of : 1. being without a gate in that area. 2. Having to package it up and drive several miles to a UPS store as that's the closest location due to being in a rural location and its totally inconvenient for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B

customer_reviews.title: Not for cats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep the cats on one side of that house after reading reviews that they wouldn’t be able to fit through the bars. DO NOT buy this for the reason I did. We have a cat with severe hip issues and she can’t jump and with the comes a lot of accidents all over the house. Thought this was a perfect answer to keep her accidents to one side of the house instead of finding poop and pee everywhere. She was able to squeeze through the bars and I thought she was going to kill herself.
customer_reviews.author: Britny

customer_reviews.title: Three and a half stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on prime day knowing I’d get a puppy soon. The installation was easy but the gate only opens up one way so if you’re looking for a gate that opens either way you’ll need to look at a different gate. My 3 month old Doberman puppy was able to push the gate away from the door frame so I had to put it behind the molding so he couldn’t push the gate. It’s good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BreReader

customer_reviews.title: But great for doorways
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work w stairs. But great for doorways. We ended up putting it at the door for our toddlers room. We like it’s tall enough so he can’t climb over. the only thing is that if we scroll the ends too tight then it squeezes the gate part so the door gets stuck and doesn’t open. And if we don’t scroll it tight enough our toddler leans himself against the gate and tries to push it open and the top part slides. So we have to constantly remember to push it back into the doorway. Hence the one star minus.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for medium/large dogs
customer_reviews.text: We are using this gate for two 70lb Medium/Large dogs......Awesome.....just freakin' awesome.....replaced an old wood type gate we all grew up with....stepping over and over and over was getting real old, and company had to also. Not anymore....the gate works very well, very soundly constructed, wood accents are nice (matches our wood flooring) easy set up and installation. We used one of the two provided extensions......the larger one, for a 37" opening. Perfect fit and adjusting the rubber boots were easy. We went all the way to the floor and the rubber boots even fit the curved molding......yep!! Can't beat the price, especially for this quality....Jet.com wasn't even close in pricing....Fast shipping....Don't hesitate buying....NICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Shifter

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking gate
customer_reviews.text: I really think this is a good looking gate. We installed it 4 days ago, but it already seems like it will be pretty durable and it is sturdy and holds up well. My toddler loves to play with it, so it is holding strong against her. The ONLY negative I have is that the gate, or part you walk through is very narrow. I have to go at an angle with my wide hips to get through. Those measurements are probably in the description, I just didn't think about it until I started walking through.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Fleischhauer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this gate used to keep my large dogs from ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this gate used to keep my large dogs from getting into the garage and eating the cat's food. We found the gateway quite narrow, so if you are carrying something (like a wash basket), its not so easy to get thru, you have to lift the basket over, then it's taller than average. The picture is a very accurate view I think. However, its meant to be tall and to be used with pets and kids not wash baskets so in that sense it would be perfect. Keeps my dogs out of the cats good in the garage!!
customer_reviews.author: LizzD

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time that I bought this gate from the same seller. If i could rate the first gate (first photo shown) I would rate it 5 stars. I bought a second one (second photo shown) and it was supposed to be the same exact gate that I ordered before, and it’s totally different and it’s not what I ordered. It is different from the first one. I can’t even open the second gate, let alone close it. If you try to make it slightly looser, the whole gate becomes unsturdy and it falls apart. This gate is a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Anna K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these baby gates, first for an Adult Family Home and for dogs. I like this one because it looks nice whereas some of the gates are trashy looking. The other thing about this gate is it is tall. Though I have a very small dog he is a jumper and could easily jump over a short gate. This is good for a jumper or a big dog. I don't have it screwed in, since he is only 7 pounds he isn't going to push it over.
customer_reviews.author: Kirajean

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this gate for my husband's office, it is really to keep the dogs out, not the kids. He had a regular baby gate up, which we had to climb over to get in and out of his office and it was a hazard. This gate is not only so much safer but looks much better as well and OUR kids can go in and out of his office when they need to. They couldn't before, they had to stand at the door and talk to him which was a huge hassle. Best "baby" aka dog gate ever!!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca l. harris

customer_reviews.title: Opening Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The gate itself is fantastic! Well made and very nice looking. Unfortunately, at this height, it covered the handle to the front door (knock number one) and the gate opening is very narrow. It was difficult to walk through with any sort of load (groceries, gym back, etc.). After knocking it out of the mounts several times in less than a week, we had to return it. It is a fantastic product but probably better suited for a low traveled door way in a interior door jam.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clevenger

customer_reviews.title: Historic Homes
customer_reviews.text: Our home is a 1920s Tudor. We bought these gates to keep our dog out of restricted rooms, while affording us the ability to keep the doors open and air circulating throughout our home (we have no air conditioning - just fans and a "swamp cooler"). Little did I know, when I purchased the gates, that they would provide an almost museum like quality to the rooms... I've tried to replicate the 1920s-1930s atmosphere... and these gates, while a "modern addition" are perfect for the decor. If you own a historic home - definitely buy these gates.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia M. Costello

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy for a 42 in doorway/hallway
customer_reviews.text: I have a 42 inch hallway I’m putting this in. I just set it up and it needs another 4 inch extension for it to be considered sturdy. There is 3 inches on each side which does not make this gate sturdy what so ever. I’m now having to pay another $18 for an extension on the Regalo website....
customer_reviews.author: Ciji Painter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate! It arrived on time and well-packaged. It was fairly simple to assemble, after figuring out on which level of the steps I wanted it placed so I could figure out which extension to use. I also bought the pressure gate wall protectors but ended up not needing them. The gate is easy to open with one hand. The humans in the house are happy with the purchase, the doggo not so much.... I do wish the warning sticker affixed to the gate was removable, but no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo7662

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We don’t use those for stairs but keeping kids out of the laundry room. It works great! I highly recommend screwing the little wall caps on because it makes it impossible for kids/pets to knock the gate down. We’ve had a similar gate but never used the mounts and as our oldest got bigger the easier it was for him to knock down. Like it so much I’ll be getting two more to keep them out of the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: APAndrooz

customer_reviews.title: I’m highly satisfied with this gate
customer_reviews.text: I’m highly satisfied with this gate! Helps keep the dog out when we’re eating and need him to not be breathing on our food. It’s got a strong hold in the wall so the dog doesn’t kick it down. It’s tall, but my 72 lb pit bull was still able to jump over it some how when we’re not home? That’s not the gate’s fault, but I wanted to note it for other pit bull owners. If your dog is less mischievous than mine, you should be good.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Robust, aesthetic gate
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when I saw that other reviewers had bigger dogs that were able to push this gate down. I have a rott/retriever mix at 65lbs and he cannot push it down. It is a fantastic looking gate. Much better looking than the the smaller regalo that it replaced. The latch is kind of a pain. I have to pull it back to get it to set in the locking groove, which isn't a big deal. 4 stars because the wood inserts are not really inserted that well. Mine swivel where they are mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian C.

customer_reviews.title: In the Middle...
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I ordered the gate. However, when it arrived it had a few rough patches on the wood. Those I could get by, but it was a struggle to get it set at the base of the stairs where I had crown molding on the baseboards. I’m pretty handy, but had to get my beau to finagle it in. Once that was all taken care of, I do like the functionality of the gate overall and I am past the initial issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this gate because it matches my floors cabinets and kitchen counters. My only dislike is that it’s notversatile in every way. However, I made it work for me. I would recommend this gate to anyone looking for something somewhat inexpensive but also good quality. The style is very complimentary. It’s not too hard to put together. I did it by myself. I have had this gate for at least 6 months and it’s still standing. Even with my Rottweiler sometimes jumping on it!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Piece with Easy Instal
customer_reviews.text: I needed a gate to put up to keep my small dogs out of an area in the house. I have another one that is plasticy white looking and cost near the same amount as this one. This gate looks good, and the locking mechanism is easy to use. Set up was a breeze. I don't like that he gate only opens one way, I'd prefer to be able to open the gate "in" from both sides, but a little tab at the bottom of the gate prevents you from using it this way. Otherwise it looks great and the wood accent happen to match our hardwood floors perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and quick set up. Once unboxed, it took me about 6 minutes to set up. I have mine located at the start of the bottom stairs. Once I found the right adjustment, I merely had to set up the four areas of support. I liked the finish on this product as it paired well with the decor of my house. The locking portion is easy for my older daughter to use while keeping our toddler from going upstairs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Russel

customer_reviews.title: You’ll LOVE these gates!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first of these gates for the hallway to block our toddler, and it’s held up fantastically! It’s very easy to open and close, and no too difficult to install (we bought Wall Nannys to prevent damage, and those are awesome too). This gate is so durable and easy to use, that we got a second one to use for our daughter’s playroom (so we can keep her in there but still hear her). I’d buy these again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: D Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Impressively well made for price point.
customer_reviews.text: This extendable doggy gate (what we use it for) works perfectly in our 36inch hallway. I will admit my gf and I were impressed by the quality and the finish of the gate when I got it. Assembly was pretty intuitive, but I did have to look at the directions. The screw in wall mount are nice, but the rubber mounts work for our more temporary purpose.
customer_reviews.author: KaZ

customer_reviews.title: Love the classy look
customer_reviews.text: This gate is perfect for keeping our dogs in or out of certain rooms. The only thing I would say that I didn't like is that it took paint off of the door trim in one room. The stained trim hasn't seen any damage though.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Bylsma

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, operates very smoothly, fits as described, just one issue, it's a narrow opening. If you're coming home with anything more than 2 grocerie bags in your hands, prepare to struggle fitting though the door way of this because it's narrow and I'm not a large person so it's not because I'm big either (5'6" 160lbs). On the good side, my son shakes it like crazy and slams the door and my dogs jump all over it and it hasn't moved or malfunctioned or shown any signs of damage
customer_reviews.author: Russell Seratelli Jr

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, Sturdy & Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this gate. I love that it’s extra tall. My opening is 37” wide and this works perfectly. The walk through securely shuts, but is easy to open with one hand. I don’t think the opening is too small as both my son and I have no problems walking through it. I am fostering a 40 lb. pup who stands against this constantly and the gate doesn’t budge. I highly recommend this gate. Wish I would have bought it years ago when I first started fostering dogs. No more climbing over gates!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ann

customer_reviews.title: This is a great, well designed sturdy gate.
customer_reviews.text: This gate is well designed, as specified, its tall which we like, its not a finicky plastic product so you can even call it decorative although that isn’t its final intention but its nice to look at and it goes well with our home. The mechanisim is simple enough to operate, but our son cant figure it out yet. The gate itself is very sturdy and strong so it seems it will last quite a few years in great condition. A plus that we’ve noticed is that our child plays with it opening and closing it and its pretty difficult for his fingers to get caught between the moving parts, that is called thoughtful design.
customer_reviews.author: Dario Carrera

customer_reviews.title: In order to have the gate pretty easy to open
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these, to block off 3 rooms, from our puppy. He is 20 lbs, and fully grown won't be more than 25 lbs. Couple things I'll say... you have to get the tension just right in order to be able to open the gate. In order to have the gate pretty easy to open, you cant have the frame very tight in the doorway. So in the past 2 days that we've had the gates, they keep coming out of the doorway. Frustrating. If I try to open the door, and have to struggle to do it, I pull the gate right out of the doorway. Not the best design. They will do, although they aren't ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality gate
customer_reviews.text: Good quality gate. Solid metal construction, and it was pretty easy to place and set up. The extensions were also nice to have. The only thing about this I wish were different was the sliding mechanism used to hold the bolts between the gate and wall. The screws don't actually screw into the gate itself. There is a hole that's larger than the screw, and it is held to gate by pressure from a plastic screw-cap type of item. It seems to hold fine for now, but I would have preferred something more substantial and actually screwed into the gate. That being said, the whole assembly seems to work fine, and with wall protectors, gets the job done rather nicely.
customer_reviews.author: F. U.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pets
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it is the perfect height to keep my dogs out but my cat can still squeeze through the bars. I use it to block off a room designated for the cat. When you first put it together it does seem like the latch is not going to work, but if you read the instructions it explains that you have to tighten it to make it push together. I really like this!
customer_reviews.author: Ashly Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate for keeping dogs out of the room
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these gates, one for the kitchen and one for the entryway, to keep the dogs contained at certain times and they work pretty good. The doorways were a little larger than a regular gate could handle, so these were the perfect size and easy to adjust. One of the gates we have to fix the latch on the bottom because it kept coming down, but other than that great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking Gate works well at shortest opening width also a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Very nice looking Gate at a good price and works very well when used at it shortest width in fortunately we need them to be used at the widest width. Good value (price) if it fits your needs. Cons- Very flimsy when extending to maximum width almost useless. Tried to return item twice from shipped to address by leaving it outside of our home and it was never picked up. Not sure if it was an Amazon issue or Carrier Issue IT WAS NOT A MANUFACTURE ISSUE but we are left with two gates we cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions.
customer_reviews.text: Received this yesterday. Set up was very easy and it looks very nice. But, the closure seems a bit cheaply made and isn't user friendly...I have to either slam it or partially engage the open button. My hall is 42" so I'm using both extensions and had to wedge it into place so it may not be an issue with those who have different width openings. Also, I don't like that it only opens one way. That makes no sense. It should swing both ways.
customer_reviews.author: jinmck

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Its easy enough for my other two ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the top of our stairs for the safety of our one year old. I was nervous at first but once installed and up, I love it. Its easy enough for my other two kiddos (8 & 5) to use and hard enough for my toddler to not open. It is very tall which is good because he can't try and climb it or lean over it. The one thing that is a bit annoying is our's is squeaky when we open the gate and close it. But that is such a small thing compared to the safety of my son.
customer_reviews.author: DFR1

customer_reviews.title: 2 Huskies
customer_reviews.text: We have two huskies and a small front foyer that has two entrances. Mad dash to the door to greet guests, which is fine except as huskies will oft do............they continue on out. We bought two of these. They both fit great with little effort for installing. Interestingly, neither dog pushed them or jumped over and they now know. Even when we leave open, they rarely venture into the foyer. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Inman

customer_reviews.title: Narrow walkthrough
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep a large dog on one side. Works well in my hallway. Easily positioned around the baseboard and chair railing. Height is fine, good latch although you have to get used to it. I think it is a narrow walk through space. Purse or briefcase you will need to turn your body sideways to walk through. (I’m a small person). We will keep it. Looks ok in the space. I got the dark color.
customer_reviews.author: AlekonaS

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the bottom of my stairs to keep my dogs from going up. Was easy to install and works great! Wish I had bought this years ago. On the banister side, I used some tie straps to hold it tightly as it did tend to want to move due to the slickness of the banister posts but it does work well. If you're using this on flat walls, you should have no issues but can also buy the larger wall cups that will help grip better. The door is easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Have had this gate for less then a year now, within a few months one of the buttons on one side broke and was unable to be unlocked from that side. Annoying, but not a huge deal as it still worked and did it’s job to keep baby contained. Today the other button broke out of nowhere, one second it was working and then next time we went to use the gate it wasn’t. Now it’s unusable, waste of money and didn’t even last a year. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Weird design, skinny gate, well built.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The design is a bit weird. You have to "tighten" it to the wall, and that same process ties the door to the lock. So, if you make it too tight,, you cant open or close the door. I am at the point where the gate door can open and close, but it still slides slightly on the wall. Alo, the gate door itself is skinnier than I imagined. It's a little hard to navigate carrying a baby through it. All that being said, it doesn't feel cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: NRyan

customer_reviews.title: Nice but slightly damaged
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this a 4 out of 5 because the packaging came quite damaged (multiple holes in the box, ripped in some areas). I can't tell if it was from the packaging that the gate has the scratch on the bottom of the post or not. I bought it to keep my 6 yr old gray tabby cat out of the upstairs of our new house. It doesn't appear she can get thru the grates which are about 2-2.5" wide. Outside of the scratch, it's a beautiful gate that functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Install, a bit unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: Joshua Garfinkle: We purchased this to use at the bottom of our stairs to keep our daughter safe and to keep our dogs from coming up to our bedrooms. It was a very oddly designed unit that was difficult to install and always felt flimsy, even with a proper install that has the gate pushed to its tolerance limits for small spacing the door can easily be pushed open by a leaning child. It is installed properly, but using a pressure system with a series of tightening devices in four locations to make the fit tighter, we have it at its tightest and still the door opens. Its only good feature is it looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Garfinkle

customer_reviews.title: Gate not perfect but ok
customer_reviews.text: We bought this gate to use outside our property was slightly slanted it or the the gate was too long which made it difficult adjusting on either side. We only used one attachment. Also one of the screws was too long. So test them. If need all of them you may run into probmems. We needed it prevent small dogs getting out. So the gate is on at slant but tight. We can still open the door. it was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R

product_meta.title: Regalo Home Accents Extra Tall and Wide Baby Gate, Bonus Kit, Includes Décor Hardwood, 4-Inch Extension Kit, 4-Inch Extension Kit, 4 Pack Pressure Mount Kit and 4 Pack Wall Cups and Mounting Kit
product_meta.description:
STURDY HARDWOOD AND STEEL CONSTRUCTION.
Can also be used for medium to large dogs.
feature_bullets: EXTRA TALL: Gate stands 37 Inch tall for added security. Expands to fit openings from 30 to 42 Inch wide. Please be sure measure your opening prior to purchase to ensure proper fit.

DÉCOR: Fashioned with high-end finishing and New Zealand Pine. Please note, before installation there will be a gap between the gate latch and the frame which is NOT a defect and it is NOT bent. This gap will be eliminated once installed.
ADJUSTABLE: Simple pressure mount set up, no tool required. Easy close handle features a one-touch release safety lock
FIT: Perfect for hallway, doorway, open spaces and bottom of stairs. Includes two 4-inch wide extensions kits. Gate folds flat for easy storage
SAFETY: Designed with safety-lock, meets all safety standard. Hardware mount for added security. Perfect for children 6-36 months. Great for PETS TOO!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,575 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
